gcci.text: With H100s holding at roughly $3.14/hr, lead times and high utilization are signaling tight supply; hyperscalers and foundries are accelerating capex to expand advanced packaging capacity, but near-term chip availability will remain the gating factor.

gtpi.text: Average input tokens at $1.25/1M reflect aggressive API price compression, as model efficiency gains and open-weight competition intensify, forcing incumbents to match pricing while optimizing throughput.

gagl.text: 120 TWh/year load translates to ~60 Mt CO2e at the current U.S. grid mix, amplifying grid strain and underscoring the need for faster nuclear, demand response, and firm renewables to keep AI growth sustainable.

aipi.text: Sentiment is cautiously optimistic: capex cycles remain robust, but inference commoditization and GPU supply constraints raise bubble risks if growth relies more on capacity than durable efficiency gains.
